TranscannoSplitTagToOne.SplitToOne

Class TranscannoManipulator.TranscannoMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperMapperImpl
      • TranscannoSplitTagToOne.SplitToOne.TranscannoManipulator.TranscannoMapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperMapper, org.corpus_tools.salt.core.GraphTraverseHandler
    Enclosing class:
    TranscannoManipulator

    public static class TranscannoManipulator.TranscannoMapper
extends org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperMapperImpl
implements org.corpus_tools.salt.core.GraphTraverseHandler
    TranscannoManipulator flattens the structure of an input document and replaces all the annotations by spans. These spans inherit all the attributes of the annotations they derive from. If 2 or more annotations have the same tagcode, they are merged into 1 span. "tagcode" is the default name of the attribute that allows to merge 2 or more annotations into 1: if the value of "tagcode" of 2 or more annotations is the same, they are merged into 1 span. However, it is possible to define another attribute that will allow to merge annotations when having the same value. It is defined via the AnnotationsUnifyingAttribute parameter. For example, if 2 XML tags with the same value of "id" should be merged together, while launching the TranscannoManipulator, we will define: AnnotationsUnifyingAttribute=id Before processing tokenises the textual data.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      With this method you can decide if a node is supposed to be visited by methods #nodeReached(GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE, String, SNode, SRelation, SNode, long) and #nodeLeft(GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE, String, SNode, SRelation, SNode, long) .

      This method is called on the way back, in depth first mode it is called for a node after all the nodes belonging to its subtree have been visited.

      This method is called for each node in document-structure, as long as #checkConstraint(GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE, String, SRelation, SNode, long) returns true for this node.

      • TranscannoMapper

        public TranscannoMapper()
        Constructor of TranscannoMapper. Initialises the annotationsUnifyingAttribute: either with the value entered by the user or with the default value "tagcode".

      • mapSDocument

        public org.corpus_tools.pepper.common.DOCUMENT_STATUS mapSDocument()
        Flattens the document structure. Replaces structures by spans. If 2 or more structures have identical tagcodes (or values of another, user-specified, attribute(=label)), they are replaced by 1 span. Before processing tokenises the textual data.
        Specified by:
        mapSDocument in interface org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperMapper
        Overrides:
        mapSDocument in class org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperMapperImpl

      • nodeReached

        public void nodeReached(org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SGraph.GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE traversalType,
                        java.lang.String traversalId,
                        org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SNode currNode,
                        org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SRelation sRelation,
                        org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SNode fromNode,
                        long order)
        This method is called for each node in document-structure, as long as #checkConstraint(GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE, String, SRelation, SNode, long) returns true for this node.
        In our dummy implementation it just collects frequencies of annotations.
        Specified by:
        nodeReached in interface org.corpus_tools.salt.core.GraphTraverseHandler

                     long order)
        This method is called on the way back, in depth first mode it is called for a node after all the nodes belonging to its subtree have been visited.
        In our dummy implementation, this method is not used.
        Specified by:
        nodeLeft in interface org.corpus_tools.salt.core.GraphTraverseHandler

      • checkConstraint

        public boolean checkConstraint(org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SGraph.GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE traversalType,
                               java.lang.String traversalId,
                               org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SRelation edge,
                               org.corpus_tools.salt.core.SNode currNode,
                               long order)
        With this method you can decide if a node is supposed to be visited by methods #nodeReached(GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE, String, SNode, SRelation, SNode, long) and #nodeLeft(GRAPH_TRAVERSE_TYPE, String, SNode, SRelation, SNode, long) . In our dummy implementation for instance we do not need to visit the nodes STextualDS.
        Specified by:
        checkConstraint in interface org.corpus_tools.salt.core.GraphTraverseHandler
